summary.title: Summary
summary.content:
I've worked across a broad spectrum of software engineering roles over >10 years, including high-frequency, event-driven backend systems, platform development, big data, machine learning, and full-stack web development.


At Expedia, I'm currently engaged in designing and implementing data capture SDKs and pipelines—managing terabytes of data and handling over 30,000 requests per second—to bolster the company's data-driven products and analytics. I significantly contributed to launching a multi-tenant platform that introduced a new, flourishing revenue stream (currently generating a revenue of > $10 million per year) by offering white-labeled web products.


At Gartner, I led the modernization of legacy products to contemporary web platforms which led to a threefold increase in revenue across those products and improved membership retention across research domains. I've driven process improvement and automation at both organizations and contributed to saving hundreds of developer hours weekly, leading to substantial cost savings.


I have a love for science, particularly physics and computer science, and it drives me to constantly expand my knowledge and skill set. And then, applying what I've learned to tackle complex and intriguing challenges is a reward in itself.

team.name: Data Capture, Data Platform and Products
team.description: I develop and manage SDKs and infrastructure for capturing high frequency user interactions and events across web products, and to transform large datasets of raw events into actionable insights for data-driven decision-making, personalization, and improved customer experience.

responsibilities.description: Leading the creation of a multi-tenant Apache Flink-based data pipeline, designed to process and stitch over 30,000 streaming events per second in near real-time, based on configurations from data producers.
Designed a data visualization tool that ingests real-time event streams from multiple sources, filtering them per UI input custom configurations to provide immediate access to live data insights.

Designed a schema integration pipeline that automates validation and dissemination of schema changes across microservices in the data capture platform, streamlining updates and saving 30 developer hours weekly.

Developing a platform that evaluates and scores data producers, enhancing data quality by reducing schema-based errors by ~22% and cutting resolution times by ~10%. This improvement streamlined the alignment between consumers and producers, boosting service efficiency and customer satisfaction.

team.name: Platform Solutions
team.description: I helped architect the control plane for a scalable, multi-tenant platform, designing and engineering customer onboarding, product selection, and automated billing, tailored for diverse internal and external customer needs. This introduced a new revenue stream for Expedia (> $10 million per year).

responsibilities.description: Contributed to the design and development of a sophisticated, multi-tenant, event-based billing system, featuring event aggregation, precise bill calculation, and extensive reporting capabilities.
Led the creation and management of microservices tailored for multi-tenant environments, focusing on customer registration, onboarding, product selection, and configuration.

Enhanced team efficiency and code integrity by leading the integration of CI/CD practices, advancing testing methods, and incorporating performance analytics with tools like DataDog, resulting in streamlined deployments, simplified error diagnosis, and minimized downtimes.

Mentored new developers, significantly contributed to team roadmap planning, and acted as one of the primary liaisons between the team and stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and alignment of project goals with stakeholder expectations.

team.name: Data Analytics and Experimentation
team.description: Improved data insights and employee benefits at Expedia Group by creating a high-refresh rate A/B testing analysis platform, streamlining data integration with Adobe Experience Platform, and facilitating travel discounts through an internal website.

responsibilities.description: Standardized user behaviour and A/B test analysis and empowered product teams across the organization by developing a flexible, customizable, low-code ETL pipeline for secure and consistent transportation of terabytes of daily data to Adobe Experience Platform.

Developed a standardized reporting and visualization platform for over 40,000 organization-wide A/B tests, enhancing the A/B test data refresh rate by more than 40 times—from once daily to over 40 refreshes a day.

Facilitated travel discounts and benefits for over 25,000 Expedia Group employees by creating an internal website that streamlines coupon generation, usage, and financial tracking of travel benefits utilization.

team.name: Quantitative Research and Analysis
team.description: Boosted revenue threefold by upgrading survey analysis to web-based platforms and sped up survey creation fivefold, while also developing data pipelines for in-depth financial analysis on 300+ organizations for CEB's (now Gartner) "Stall Points" research.

responsibilities.description: Tripled revenue of survey based research products across various research domains by transforming client-facing survey analysis and reporting from basic Excel dashboards to advanced, flexible web-based platforms with enhanced analytical capabilities. Additionally, accelerated survey creation by research teams fivefold through the development of a declarative schema-based survey generation UI.
Crafted data collection pipelines and conducted quantitative and qualitative analyses on public financial data and news for 300+ organizations, supporting CEB's (now Gartner) "Stall Points" research.

team.name: Digital Products and Analysis
team.description: Improved research capabilities by automating digital workflows, creating a web analytics platform, and developing sophisticated data collection tools, significantly saving time and improving decision-making.

responsibilities.description: Cut manual work hours by approximately 500 hours per month through automations in web development, data standardization, and digital publishing, streamlining the creation and release of digital products.
Enhanced the research strategies of product teams across multiple domains by developing an analytics and reporting platform for web consumption data, optimizing decision-making processes.
Facilitated the research process through the development of web crawlers and tools for data collection, structuring, and standardization.
